text: Keith Noel Emerson (2 November 1944 â€“ 10 March 2016) was an English keyboardist and composer. Emerson played in a number of bands before he found his first commercial success with P. P. Arnold's backing band the Nice in the late 1960s. Emerson was born in Todmorden, West Riding of Yorkshire. He was a founding member of Emerson, Lake & Palmer (ELP) in 1970. Emerson, Lake & Palmer were successful through much of the 1970s. They became one of the best- known progressive rock groups of the era. Emerson committed suicide by shooting himself in the head at his Santa Monica, California home. He was aged 71. == Further reading == * Emerson, Keith (2003), Pictures of an Exhibitionist: From the Nice to Emerson, Lake and Palmer - The True Story of the Man Who Changed the Sound of Rock, John Blake, * Forrester, George, Martyn Hanson and Frank Askew. Emerson, Lake & Palmer, The Show That Never Ends, A Musical Biography. (2001) Helter Skelter Publishing . * * Macan, Edward (2006), Endless Enigma: A Musical Biography of Emerson, Lake and Palmer, Feedback Series in Contemporary Music, Vol. 4, Open Court, * ==References== Category:1944 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Suicides Category:English composers Category:Musicians from West Yorkshire Category:Musicians who committed suicide
title: Keith Emerson
